result.execSummary:
The defendant Alexander Joseph Rodaks was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. No contact with J. Drover directly or indirectly. No phone calls, e-mails, text messages, written communications or by third party.
Upon successful completion of probation term, Defendant may petition the Court for expungement pursuant to s. 973.015.
DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

timeConds.notes: Defendant is entitled to Huber Privileges. No Good Time Credit.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Information for Defendants After Felony Conviction - Warning not to Possess Firearms

Case called @ 4:01 p.m. Defendant Alexander Joseph Rodaks in court with attorney Max Wayne Saylor.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Saylor notes a possible conflict as he previously represented a co-defendant in another jurisdiction. The defendant waives any possible conflict. The Court entertains waiver of the preliminary hearing. The Court accepts voluntary waiver of the preliminary hearing. Defendant BOT. Information filed. Receipt admitted - Reading waived.  Defendant advised of potential punishment.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed. Upon motion of the State the Court amends Ct 1 to Poss of a Narcotic Drug as a PTAC contrary to Wis Stat 961.41(3g)(am). Plea: NC. Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Sentencing argument by DA Blader. Sentencing argument by Atty Saylor. No statement by DE. Court orders: S/W 3 years probation - Conditions: 25 days WC Jail - Huber, No GT, No CFTS - Sentence to commence by no later than September 1, 2016, AODA and follow through, defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician, NC w/ J. Drover, Costs w/ 60 DTP or PP, DNA Sample and Surcharge ordered by the Court. Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice. Upon successful completion of probation term, Defendant may petition the Court for expungement pursuant to s. 973.015.. Appeal rights given.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 27, 2016 at 03:45 pm.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Max Wayne Saylor in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Saylor requests plea/sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 27, 2016 at 03:45 pm.
Status conference on June 28, 2016 at 09:55 am.

Status conference scheduled for June 28, 2016 at 09:55 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 27, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

records.addlTxt: Case Called @ 1:12 PM: Defendant Alexander Joseph Rodaks in court with attorney Max Wayne Saylor.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Preliminary Hearing and Time Limits discussed.  Defendant wishes to waive time limits for preliminary hearing. Court questions defendant and accepts waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing.  ADA argues as to $2500 Signature Bond w/conditions.  No objection as to bond request.    STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Status conference scheduled for March 15, 2016 at 09:25 am.
